description: Identifier of the preventive maintenance template or task this frequency rule belongs to.
Line number within the task’s frequency set; distinguishes multiple rules for the same task.
Sequence used to order evaluation or execution when multiple triggers exist for the same task.
Kind of trigger used to schedule the task, such as time-based or utilization-based.
Free-text description of the timing condition for this rule; likely for user readability, not used for logic—confirm with SME.
Scheduling behavior for the rule (e.g., fixed vs. floating/last-completion based); likely controls how due dates roll forward—confirm with SME.
User account that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User account that last modified the record.
Timestamp of the most recent modification.
Numeric interval value; used with the unit field to compute when the task becomes due.
Unit of measure for the interval, paired with the count to determine due thresholds (time or utilization units).
Context or source the frequency applies to, likely the measurement or date anchor for the trigger; confirm with SME.
